The '''Protocol to the 1979 Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution on the Reduction of Sulphur Emissions or their Transboundary Fluxes by at least 30 per cent''' is a 1985 protocol to the [[Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution]] agreement that provided for a 30 per cent reduction in [[sulfur|sulphur]] emissions or transboundary fluxes by 1993. The protocol has been supplemented by the [[1994 Oslo Protocol on Further Reduction of Sulphur Emissions]].
''opened for signature'' - July 8, 1985
''entered into force'' - September 2, 1987
''parties'' - (25) [[Albania]], [[Austria]], [[Belarus]], [[Belgium]], [[Bulgaria]], [[Canada]], [[Czech Republic]], [[Denmark]], [[Estonia]], [[Finland]], [[France]], [[Germany]], [[Hungary]], [[Italy]], [[Liechtenstein]], [[Lithuania]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Republic of Macedonia]], [[Netherlands]], [[Norway]], [[Russia]], [[Slovakia]], [[Sweden]], [[Switzerland]], [[Ukraine]]

{{Lead too short|date=April 2013}}
The '''2012 Romanian constitutional crisis''' was a major political and constitutional conflict between [[President of Romania|President]] [[Traian Băsescu]] and [[Prime Minister of Romania|Prime Minister]] [[Victor Ponta]] of [[Romania]]. A dispute arose between the two regarding the representation of Romania to the [[European Council]] reunion of June 28, 2012. The dispute degenerated in [[civil disobedience]] and conflicting views between political parties.<ref>[https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/07/us-romania-politics-idUSBRE86609I20120707 "Germany, U.S: Romania power struggle hurts democracy"], ''Reuters''</ref> On 12 December 2012, Băsescu and Ponta signed an agreement on institutional cohabitation, effectively ending the crisis.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://rnews.ro/2013/05/07/1-an-de-guvernare-usl-acordul-de-coabitare-ponta-basescu/ | title=1 an de guvernare USL: acordul de coabitare Ponta – Băsescu | publisher=R/NEWS | date=2013-05-07 | accessdate=2013-05-30}}</ref>
==Background== {{see also|2012 Romanian protests}} President [[Traian Băsescu]] and Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]] became locked in a constitutional judicial conflict over Romania's representation at the June 28, 2012 meeting of the European Council. President Traian Băsescu submitted a complaint to Romania's Constitutional Court in point of the conflict with Government concerning the representation on the European Council. Ponta declared to the Romanian press agency Mediafax that misconception claimed by President Băsescu to the Constitutional Court is between Presidency and Parliament, and Court judges can only determine the existence of a conflict, that can not be solved only by amending the Constitution.<ref>[http://www.bzi.ro/ccr-decide-astazi-cine-va-merge-la-consiliul-european-297560 "CCR decides today who will go to the European Council"], ''Bună Ziua Iași''</ref>
Parliament plenary adopted on June 12, 2012, with 249 votes in favor, 30 against and two abstentions, a political declaration recommending that at European Council meeting on June 28 Romania to be represented by Premier Victor Ponta, not by President Traian Băsescu.<ref>[http://www.agenda.ro/news/news/56427/parlamentul-il-trimite-pe-victor-ponta-la-consiliul-european-%7C-video.html "Parliament sends Victor Ponta to the European Council"], ''Agenda''</ref> That decision triggered a fierce conflict between the two Palaces. {{As of |2012}}, President Traian Băsescu sent to Premier Victor Ponta a letter which drew attention that participation in the European Council without a mandate from the President legally equalizes with ownership of a constitutional prerogatives of the President. At a press conference, Ponta broke the letter, ironically replying this gesture.<ref>[http://www.tvrinfo.ro/conflictul-dintre-ponta-si-basescu--transat-la-ccr--premiera--premierul-va-fi-prezent-la-sedinta_17904.html "Prime Minister Victor Ponta officially announces its departure to Brussels. Presidency without reaction"], ''TVRinfo.ro''</ref>
On June 27, Constitutional Court decides that the President is required to attend the European Council in [[Brussels]]. Ponta respond in a way that nobody expected. Government takes in authority the Official Monitor, delaying publication of the Constitutional Court decision, regarding participation in European Council and making the presence of Victor Ponta in Brussels to be legal.
===Plagiarism controversy=== [[File:My name is Paste. Copy Paste, proteste Victoria 9-7-12.JPG|thumb|left|Protest in [[Victory Square, Bucharest]] against Ponta Cabinet]] [[Victor Ponta]] obtained his PhD in law from the [[University of Bucharest]], in July 2003, with a thesis entitled "International Criminal Court". Scientific advisor of this piece of work was [[Adrian Năstase]], then Prime Minister in office, who serves a 1-year sentence in prison since 2012.
On June 18, 2012, online edition of '' Nature'' magazine published the news that Victor Ponta, "Prime Minister of Romania, has been accused of copying large sections of his 2003 PhD thesis in law from previous publications, without proper reference".<ref>[http://www.nature.com/news/romanian-prime-minister-accused-of-plagiarism-1.10845 "Romanian prime minister accused of plagiarism"], ''Nature.com''</ref> The charge was made on the basis of documents compiled by an anonymous [[whistleblower]]. "Ponta obtained his doctorate from the University of Bucharest while he was Secretary of State in [[Năstase I Cabinet]], who was his doctoral thesis supervisor", the author writes.
Concomitantly, imputation of plagiarism was also published by German newspaper [[Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung]].<ref>[http://www.faz.net/aktuell/wirtschaft/abgeschrieben-plagiatsvorwurf-gegen-rumaeniens-ministerpraesident-11790951.html "Plagiatsvorwurf gegen Rumäniens Ministerpräsident"], ''Faz.net''</ref> Karl Peter Schwarz, a journalist from the newspaper and author of the inquiry published by him, commented on the subject in an interview on June 20, 2012, in which showed that the case would be worse than plagiarists politicians in [[Germany]] and [[Hungary]], whereas the latter "didn't copy whole pages of the thesis, as he did".<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-12575002-interviu-karl-peter-schwarz-autorul-anchetei-din-ziarul-german-frankfurter-allgemeine-zeitung-cazul-ponta-mai-grav-decat-cazurile-schmitt-guttemberg-pentru-nu-copiat-pagini-intregi-ale-tezei-asa-cum-f.htm "Karl Peter Schwarz, author of the inquiry of German newspaper Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung: Ponta case is worse than Schmitt and Guttemberg cases «because they didn't copy entire pages of the thesis, as he did»"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref> News from ''Nature'', about plagiarism, were resumed by Romanian and international press, in [[România Liberă]],<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/plagiat-ponta-autorii-articolului-din-nature-pentru-rl-nu-avem-niciun-dubiu-asupra-credibilitatii-surselor-noastre-267891.html "Ponta's plagiarism. The authors of «Nature» for RL: «We have no doubt on the credibility of our sources»"], ''România Liberă''</ref> [[Hotnews.ro]],<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-12557504-breaking-news-revista-nature-premierul-roman-victor-ponta-acuzat-plagiat.htm "''Nature'' magazine: Romanian Prime Minister Victor Ponta, accused of plagiarism"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref> [[Financial Times Deutschland]],<ref>[http://www.ftd.de/politik/europa/:doktorarbeit-rumaenischer-ministerpraesident-unter-plagiatsverdacht/70051680.html#f1 "Rumänischer Ministerpräsident unter Plagiatsverdacht"], ''Financial Times Deutschland''</ref> [[The Guardian]],<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jun/19/romanian-prime-minister-plagiarism "Romanian prime minister accused of plagiarism"], ''The Guardian''</ref> weekly [[Die Zeit]],<ref>[http://www.zeit.de/politik/ausland/2012-06/rumaenien-regierungschef-plagiatsvorwurf "Plagiatsvorwürfe gegen Rumäniens Regierungschef"], ''Zeit.de''</ref> [[Il Messaggero]] ([[Italy]]),<ref>[http://www.ilmessaggero.it/primopiano/esteri/il_premier_rumeno_ponta_nei_guai_ha_copiato_la_tesi/notizie/203354.shtml "Il premier rumeno Ponta nei guai: «Ha copiato la tesi»"], ''Il Messaggero''</ref> [[El Mundo (Spain)]],<ref>[http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2012/06/18/internacional/1340045245.html "El primer ministro rumano Victor Pontas, acusado de plagiar su tesis doctoral"], ''El Mundo''</ref> [[The Hindu]] ([[India]]),<ref>[http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/article3546379.ece "Romanian PM accused of plagiarism by ''Nature''], ''The Hindu''</ref> [[Le Monde]],<ref>[http://bigbrowser.blog.lemonde.fr/2012/06/19/bac-si-vous-plagiez-ne-soyez-pas-premier-ministre-en-roumanie/ "BAC – Si vous plagiez, ne soyez pas premier ministre en Roumanie"], ''Le Monde''</ref> [[BBC]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-18505325 "Romanian PM Victor Ponta rejects plagiarism claim"], ''BBC News''</ref>
A document published by [[Romanian Television|TVR]] presents the passages of thesis copied in parallel with source texts. It appears that much of the work was copied, word for word, from the following works:<ref>[http://media.tvrinfo.ro/other/201206/oglinda-vp-2003-teza_94614100.pdf Comparison: PhD thesis and source texts], ''TVRinfo.ro''</ref> * Diaconu, D.: ''International Criminal Court, History and Reality'', All Beck Publishing House, 1999; * Crețu, V.: ''International Criminal Law'', Tempus Publishing House, 1996; * Diaconu, I.: ''The International Criminal Court: A New Stage'', Nicolae Titulescu Romanian Inst. International Studies, 2002; * Duculescu, V.: preface to the work of D. Diaconu, ''International Criminal Court, History and Reality''.
Members of the National Council for the Recognition of Degrees, Diplomas and Certificates decided, after examining the thesis of PM Ponta, that he had plagiarized 85 pages of the work,<ref>[http://www.romania-actualitati.ro/victor_ponta_a_plagiat_85_de_pagini_din_lucrarea_de_doctorat-42355 "Victor Ponta «plagiarized 85 pages» of doctoral thesis"], ''Radio România Actualități''</ref> although in the press had conveyed numbers from 30<ref>[http://www.revista22.ro/doctorul-ponta-si-plagiatul-15788.html "Dr. Ponta and plagiarism"], ''Revista 22''</ref> to about 130 pages plagiarized from these works.<ref>[http://www.ziare.com/victor-ponta/plagiat/plagiatul-lui-victor-ponta-vezi-documentele-care-sustin-acuzatiile-1173905 "Victor Ponta's plagiarism - see documents supporting allegations"], ''Ziare.com''</ref>
A detailed analysis in parallel of the texts conducted by journalists from ''România Liberă'' indicated not only a taking over of the informative parts, but also of the authors' personal assessments, of the rhetorical questions put by them, of the references to older texts of the same author, and orthography mistakes.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/plagiat-ponta-premierul-a-preluat-inclusiv-greseli-gramaticale-si-aprecieri-personale-268005.html "Ponta's plagiarism. The prime minister took inclusive grammatical mistakes and personal assessments"], ''România Liberă''</ref> The doctoral thesis was subsequently published in book form, with a preface signed by even I. Diaconu (author of one of the three plagiarized works), having Daniela Coman as co-author. Other sources indicate author's preface as Adrian Năstase.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/plagiat-ponta-patru-profesori-de-drept-desfiinteaza-apararea-premierului-268016.html "Ponta's plagiarism. Four law professors dissolved PM defense"], ''România Liberă''</ref>
On the other hand, National Ethics Council decided on July 18, 2012 that Ponta didn't plagiarize.<ref>[http://www.evz.ro/detalii/stiri/cine-l-a-spalat-pe-ponta-de-plagiat-printre-membrii-cne-un-fost-deputat-psd-992787.html "Who cleaned Ponta of plagiarism. Chairman of the Board, specialist in agriculture. Some CNE members, former PCR coups"], ''Evz.ro''</ref> {{quote|(...) council was regenerated by former interim minister Liviu Pop, so that the result of an analysis simulation of the work can be controlled.|Cristina Olivia Moldovan|[[Evenimentul Zilei]]}} On July 20, 2012, Ethics Committee of the University of Bucharest decided that Victor Ponta deliberately plagiarized, finding passages copied on 115 pages of the 297 (namely the thesis excluding Năstase's preface and appendices).<ref>[http://www.adevarul.ro/actualitate/Universitatea_Bucuresti_prezinta_azi_verdictul_comisiei_sale_in_cazul_doctoratului_lui_Ponta_0_740326049.html "University of Bucharest: Victor Ponta plagiarized and deliberately plagiarized. Number of pages with copy-paste rose to 115"], ''Adevărul.ro''</ref> In the same day, ''Nature'' magazine related about contradictory verdicts of Government Ethics Commission and Ethics Committee of the University.<ref>[http://www.nature.com/news/conflicting-verdicts-on-romanian-prime-minister-s-plagiarism-1.11047 "Conflicting verdicts on Romanian prime minister's plagiarism"], ''Nature.com''</ref><ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/educatie/plagiat-ponta-vezi-pozitia-revistei-nature-in-legatura-cu-verdictul-comisiilor-care-l-au-anchetat-pe-premier-271178.html "Ponta's plagiarism. See the position of «Nature» magazine about the committees' verdict that have investigated the premier"], ''România Liberă''</ref>
===''Diesel fuel'' dossier === [[File:Elena Udrea bgiu.jpg|thumb|150px|[[Elena Udrea]] was intercepted four times in the dossier.]] President Traian Băsescu and former [[Ministry of Regional Development and Tourism (Romania)|Minister of Regional Development and Tourism]], [[Elena Udrea]], were intercepted in the dossier of former head of National Agency for Fiscal Administration, Sorin Blejnar.<ref>[http://www.agentia.org/teoria-conspiratiei/dosarul-motorina-discu-ii-ale-lui-traian-b-sescu-i-elenei-udrea-cu-sorin-blejnat-interceptate-de-procurori-37665.html "The Dossier «Diesel fuel». Discussion of Traian Băsescu and Elena Udrea with Sorin Blejnar, intercepted by prosecutors"], ''Agenția de Investigații Media''</ref> President Băsescu spoke on the phone with Blejnar about [[Rompetrol]] problem, but also about the situation of a company that has contracts with the State. Elena Udrea also had four discussions with Blejnar, in that they fixed appointments.<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/traian-basescu-interceptat-in-dosarul-lui-sorin-blejnar_49643.html "Traian Băsescu and Elena Udrea, intercepted in Sorin Blejnar's Dossier «Diesel fuel»"], ''România TV''</ref>
The phone of former head of the IRS was heard by prosecutors in the case of [[diesel fuel]] imports in [[Brașov]], in that the former head of NAFA was indicted by DIICOT prosecutors for favoring the offender.
Sorin Blejnar called in September 2010 the President Traian Băsescu, to inform him about a construction company, which has won numerous contracts with the State and which has debts. The company belongs to some PDL friends. Likewise, President demanded explanations about Rompetrol and told Blejnar to find solutions together with the [[Ministry of Justice (Romania)|Minister of Justice]].<ref>[http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/traian-basescu-interceptat-in-dosarul-lui-sorin-blejnar-10246531 "Transcript of a discussion Blejnar-Băsescu. Presidency: Discussions focused Rompetrol debts. Collecting debts is subject to CSAT"], ''Mediafax.ro''</ref>
The Presidential Administration recognized the interceptions in DIICOT dossier. According to the Presidency, talks between President Băsescu and former head of NAFA focused on the recovery of Rompetrol company's debts to the State, given that combating tax evasion and collection of receivables from the state budget made the object of a CSAT decision of 28 June 2010.<ref>[http://www.ghimpele.ro/2012/10/cum-explica-traian-basescu-interceptarile-telefonice-in-dosarul-lui-sorin-blejnar/ "Băsescu's statements on the DIICOT interceptions in Sorin Blejnar's dossier"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130416172521/http://www.ghimpele.ro/2012/10/cum-explica-traian-basescu-interceptarile-telefonice-in-dosarul-lui-sorin-blejnar/ |date=2013-04-16 }}, ''Ghimpele.ro''</ref>
The judicial inspection of the Superior Council of Magistracy initiated an investigation to see if the DIICOT case prosecutor in the Dossier "Diesel fuel" complied with the procedure when introduced interceptions with President Traian Băsescu in the dossier devoid of classifying them and to investigate a possible leak from Brașov Court.<ref>[http://www.realitatea.net/csm-s-a-sesizat-in-cazul-stenogramelor-blejnar-cum-a-ajuns-basescu-in-ele_1034670.html "CSM seized for transcripts of Blejnar dossier. How did Băsescu attained them?"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121021103853/http://www.realitatea.net/csm-s-a-sesizat-in-cazul-stenogramelor-blejnar-cum-a-ajuns-basescu-in-ele_1034670.html |date=2012-10-21 }}, ''Realitatea.net''</ref>
====Communique issued by the Presidential Administration==== {{Quote box |quote = Regarding to the appearance in the media of the interception of telephone conversations between the President of Romania, Mr. Traian Băsescu, and former president of the National Agency for Fiscal Administration, Sorin Blejnar, Presidential Administration made the following comments: :(1) – is about three wiretaps of Mr. President Traian Băsescu and Sorin Blejnar; :(2) – discussions focused on debts recovery of Rompetrol company that has towards the Romanian state given that given that combating tax evasion and collection of receivables from the state budget made the object of a Supreme Council of National Defence decision of 28 June 2010, and President of Romania is also the chairman of CSAT; :(3) – Rompetrol debt recovery to the Romanian state was also the subject of discussion at the highest level between the President of Romania, Mr. Traian Băsescu, and [[President of Kazakhstan]], Mr. [[Nursultan Nazarbayev]], during the two visits that the President has done in [[Astana]] ([[Kazakhstan]]) in 2010 (2 to 3 March 2010 respectively, 1 to 2 December 2010), since the Rompetrol company was acquired by [[KazMunayGas]] company, owned by Kazakhstan; :(4) – a honest reading of discussions indicates that Mr. President Traian Băsescu discussed with Mr. Sorin Blejnar about Rompetrol company debts recovery to the Romanian state. |source = [http://www.rtv.net/cum-explica-traian-basescu-interceptarile-diicot-in-dosarul-lui-sorin-blejnar_49652.html ''How Băsescu explains DIICOT interceptions in Sorin Blejnar's dossier'', '''România TV'''] |quoted = 1 |width = 100% |align = left }}
=== SCM scandal === On January 4, 2013, there were held elections for the offices of President and Vice-President of the [[Romanian judicial reform|Superior Council of Magistracy]]. The prosecutor Oana Schmidt Hăineală was chosen as president of the SCM, after being heard by the members of SCM, with his rival, the judge Mircea Aron.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/news/eveniment/judecatorul-mircea-aron-procurorul-oana-schmidt-haineala-candideaza-presedintia-consiliului-superior-magistraturii-1_50e699f5596d7200916f9988/index.html# |language=Romanian|title=Premieră în justiție: un procuror a fost ales președinte al CSM. Oana Schmidt Hăineală va conduce Consiliul pentru un an |work=Gândul.info |date=January 4, 2013}}</ref> The conduct of elections triggered disputes and controversies between Superior Council of Magistracy and National Union of Judges in Romania, that roughly criticized the elections, whereon it considers untransparent and unprofessional.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/news/eveniment/uniunea-judecatorilor-critica-alegerea-procurorului-oana-haineala-sefia-csm-1_50ea9b0256a0a6567e4b2d39/index.html# |language=Romanian|title=Uniunea Judecătorilor critică alegerea procurorului Oana Hăineală la șefia CSM |work=Gândul.info |date=January 7, 2013}}</ref> Likewise, the Magistrates Association in Romania expressed dissatisfaction with the appointment of Oana Hăineală as head of the SCM.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/news/eveniment/magistratii-nu-acord-numirea-unui-procuror-sefia-csm-1_50e858ff596d7200917b45c1/index.html# |language=Romanian|title=Asociația Magistraților nu este de acord cu numirea unui procuror la șefia CSM |work=Gândul.info |date=January 5, 2013}}</ref>
As a release of the situation, the Department for judges of the Superior Council of Magistracy demanded the resignation of honor of Oana Schmidt Hăineală as president of SCM and, simultaneously, asked judges Alina Ghica and Cristi Danileț to relinquish the nomination for Vice-President of the Council.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/social/judecatorii-din-csm-cer-demisia-de-onoare-a-oanei-schmidt-haineala-din-functia-de-presedinte-10462792 |language=Romanian|title=Judecătorii din CSM cer demisia de onoare a Oanei Schmidt Hăineală din funcția de președinte |work=Mediafax.ro |date=January 14, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ziuaveche.ro/actualitate-interna/investigatii/lumea-justitiei-2/scandalul-din-csm-continua-sectia-de-judecatori-cere-demisia-lui-schmidt-haineala-143115.html |language=Romanian|title=Scandalul din CSM, continuă. Secția de judecători cere demisia lui Schmidt-Hăineală |work=Ziua Veche |date=January 14, 2013}}</ref>
=== Corruption scandal === In a report on justice in Romania, drawn up by the [[European Commission]] on January 30, 2013, appear three ministers investigated for corruption.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/comisia-europeana-doi-ministri-cercetati-pentru-fapte-de-coruptie-nu-trei-vezi-cine-a-scapat-292118.html "European Commission: Two ministers investigated for corruption, not three. See who escaped"], ''România Liberă''</ref> According to a European official, two of ministers referred to in the CVM report are [[Liviu Dragnea]] and [[Varujan Vosganian]]. According to Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]], the third one is [[Relu Fenechiu]]. Dragnea is being investigated for alleged involvement in fraud in the referendum regarding the dismissal of President [[Traian Băsescu]]. Fenechiu was prosecuted, in the summer of 2012, in Transformer dossier, in which he's charged with complicity in abuse of office.<ref>[http://www.antena3.ro/politica/crin-antonescu-raportul-mcv-determina-prejudicii-romaniei-201609.html "Crin Antonescu: The CVM report causes prejudices to Romania"], ''Antena3.ro''</ref><ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-14125420-comisia-europeana-facut-modificare-raportul-justitie-doi-loc-trei-ministri-cercetati-penal-pentru-fapte-coruptie.htm "The European Commission has made a change in the Justice report: Two instead of three ministers under investigation for corruption offenses"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref>
Likewise, the European Commission Report on the Cooperation and Verification Mechanism records that there's intimidation and harassment against individuals in state institutions, like National Integrity Agency, Constitutional Court, High Court of Cassation and Superior Council of Magistracy.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/justitie/document-comisia-europeana-critica-romania-in-raportul-mcv-nu-exista-independenta-in-justitie-291887.html "Document. European Commission criticizes Romania in CVM report: The judicial independence doesn't exist"], ''România Liberă''</ref> "The judicial independence doesn't exist", affirmed Mark Gray, European Commission spokesman.
==Beginning of crisis == {{double image|right|Wiki ponta.jpg|146|Traian Băsescu, at the International Conference in Support of the new Libya (cropped).jpg|127|[[Victor Ponta]] (left) and [[Traian Băsescu]] (right)}} Traian Băsescu's troubles began on June 18. [[Hidroelectrica]], a state-owned energy company announced that it was [[bankrupt|insolvent]]. It was a move that Ponta hit the "smart guys", which have signed contracts with all governments (right- or left-wing) to buy cheap energy from Hidroelectrica. On the same day, Victor Ponta became embroiled in a plagiarism scandal: ''Nature'' magazine claimed that the Premier copied his dissertation in 2003.<ref>[http://m.ziuanews.ro/dezvaluiri-investigatii/atac-si-contraatac-17001 "Traian Băsescu and Victor Ponta are among the most hard fight for power in recent years"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130416112230/http://m.ziuanews.ro/dezvaluiri-investigatii/atac-si-contraatac-17001 |date=2013-04-16 }}, ''Ziua News''</ref><ref>[http://www.rtv.net/reuters-acuzatiile-de-plagiat-la-adresa-lui-ponta-alimenteaza-instabilitatea-in-romania_34369.html "Reuters: Allegations of plagiarism against Ponta fed instability in Romania"], ''România TV''</ref>
On June 20, former PSD leader and premier and Ponta's political mentor [[Adrian Năstase]] was sentenced to two years of imprisonment after conviction in a corruption trial due to his alleged involvement in the dossier "Quality Trophy". The same evening, as police arrived at his home to escort him to prison, Năstase shot himself in an apparent suicide attempt and was transported to Floreasca Hospital.<ref>[http://www.adevarul.ro/actualitate/politica/Politia_a_venit_dupa_Adrian_Nastase_0_722328150.html# "Adrian Năstase shot himself in the neck. Ponta was at hospital"], ''Adevărul.ro''</ref> A week later, Adrian Năstase was transferred to Rahova Prison Hospital. <!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:Ponta si basescu 55083900.jpg|thumb|200px|War between Ponta and Băsescu was severely criticized in the international press]] --> On June 25, the [[Romanian Senate]] decided to alter the functioning of the Constitutional Court law, such that the court will not be able to rule on Parliament decisions, thus facilitating the procedure for suspension of the President. In the following days, the [[Chamber of Deputies]] approved the referendum law amendment, which established that the President can be dismissed easily, only half the votes of those who come to the polls. Until that point, the law stipulated that the President is dismissed only if the proposal was passed by majority of voters registered on electoral lists. On June 27, the Pure uninominal law, initiated by Victor Ponta and [[Crin Antonescu]], is declared unconstitutional. In the same day, PDL attack to the Constitutional Court the referendum law and the Constitutional Court Law amending.
In press occurs rumors about filing a penal complaint at Parquet against Victor Ponta by Traian Băsescu, as the Prime Minister to be, then suspended from office. President denies this version, but accuses Ponta that represents illegitimate Romania in Brussels. National Council for Titles, Diplomas and Certificates establishes that Victor Ponta plagiarized in his PhD thesis. Council claims that 85 pages are copied and called for the title of doctor withdrawal. But, before the verdict, Interim Minister of Education, Liviu Pop, dissolved the National Council for Titles, Diplomas and Certificates, such that the decision was void.
On July 3, the [[Romanian Parliament]], at proposal of majority represented by [[Social Liberal Union|USL]], vote dismissal of [[President of the Senate of Romania|President of the Senate]], PDL leader [[Vasile Blaga]], [[President of the Chamber of Deputies of Romania|President of the Chamber of Deputies]], PDL member [[Roberta Anastase]] and [[Ombudsman]].<ref>[http://www.capital.ro/detalii-articole/stiri/usl-cere-revocarea-din-functie-a-robertei-anastase-si-a-lui-vasile-blaga-168644.html "USL requires dismissal of Roberta Anastase and Vasile Blaga"], ''Capital''</ref> Through an Emergency Ordinance, government restricts the attributions of the [[Constitutional Court of Romania|Constitutional Court]], restoring them to the 2010 status quo.
==President's suspension== Băsescu was suspended as [[President of Romania]], by [[Parliament of Romania|Parliament]], with 256 votes in favor and 114 against. There were two abstentions. After announcing the results, Parliament proposed that the presidential impeachment [[Romanian presidential impeachment referendum, 2012|referendum]] to be held on July 29, 2012, proposal approved by the plenary with 242 votes in favor.<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/politica/traian-basescu-a-fost-suspendat-vreau-sa-cred-ca-romanii-nu-si-doresc-linistea-din-vremea-lui-iliescu-marele-argument-al-suspendacilor-este-ca-nu-am-popularitate-9820801 "Traian Băsescu was suspended"], ''Gândul.info''</ref><ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2012/07/06/world/europe/romania-impeachment/index.html "Romanian president suspended"], ''CNN''</ref><ref>[http://www.euronews.com/2012/07/06/romania-parliament-votes-to-suspend-president-basescu/ "Romania parliament votes to suspend President Băsescu"], ''Euronews''</ref><ref>[https://archive.is/20130422062253/http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/articles/360425/20120706/romania-parliament-votes-to-suspend-president.htm "Romania parliament votes to suspend president"], ''International Business Times''</ref> Suspended president notified the Constitutional Court, calling for a constitutional legal conflict between president and Parliament. "I do not defend the seat, but I want to defend the office", President explained. Therewith, he reiterated accusations against [[Social Liberal Union|USL]] and its leaders, accusing them of lying and wanted to subordinate the justice. "If I return as president it will still be impossible for thieves and impostors from politics to negotiate with me their calmness. I think that Romanians do not want the peace during Iliescu government. I can not guarantee that I will continue to be a strong nut for those who believe that Romania can go forward with a justice that protects thieves", [[Băsescu]] said.
He added that "suspender's great argument is that I haven't popularity", and if he will be reappointed at referendum and he will find Victor Ponta in office he will never entrust the prime minister function.
On the other hand, [[Social Liberal Union|USL]] leaders [[Crin Antonescu]] and [[Victor Ponta]] ensured that there will be no pressure for justice and for other state institutions.
[[Victor Ponta]] said that during this period of political crisis his family received threats, having to resort to state institutions for protection.<ref>[http://www.mediafax.ro/english/romanian-president-suspended-by-parliament-referendum-on-july-29-9824770 "Romanian President suspended By Parliament, referendum on July 29"], ''Mediafax.ro''</ref>
On July 9, the [[Constitutional Court of Romania|Constitutional Court]] ascertained [[President of Romania|President]] [[Băsescu]]'s suspension and confirmed [[Crin Antonescu]] as [[President of Romania|Interim President]].<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/ccr-a-validat-suspendarea-lui-basescu-crin-antonescu-este-presedinte-interimar_35418.html "CCR validated Băsescu's suspension. Crin Antonescu is interim president"], ''România TV''</ref> Therewith, [[Constitutional Court of Romania|Constitutional Court]] rejected complaints formulated by [[Vasile Blaga]] and [[Roberta Anastase]], supported by [[Democratic Liberal Party (Romania)|PDL]], regarding removal from office of [[President of the Senate of Romania|President of the Senate]], respectively [[President of the Chamber of Deputies of Romania|President of the Chamber of Deputies]].<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/ccr-revocarile-lui-vasile-blaga-si-a-robertei-anastase-constitutionale_35447.html "CCR: Vasile Blaga and Roberta Anastase revocations, constitutional"], ''România TV''</ref>
On July 19, [[Social Liberal Union|USL]] laid down, at the Office of the [[High Court of Cassation and Justice]], a penal complaint against suspended [[President of Romania|President]] [[Traian Băsescu]] and other 14 people, for "spreading false information, for defamation of the country and the nation and for endangering safety of the national economy and currency stability".<ref>[http://www.realitatea.net/usl-a-depus-plangere-penala-impotriva-lui-oltean--basescu-si-alti-13-pedelisti--vezi-ce-spune-oltean_971299.html "USL laid down penal complaint against Oprea, Băsescu and other 13 people"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304060538/http://www.realitatea.net/usl-a-depus-plangere-penala-impotriva-lui-oltean--basescu-si-alti-13-pedelisti--vezi-ce-spune-oltean_971299.html |date=2016-03-04 }}, ''Realitatea.net''</ref>
=== Motives invoked for suspension === # The President usurped the role of prime minister and substituted him in the constitutional attributions of the Government. # The President repeatedly violated fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens provided in the Constitution. # The President repeatedly violated the principle of separation of powers and judicial independence. # The President has initiated an unconstitutional project to revise the Constitution and violated the constitutional review procedure provided by the fundamental law. # The President abetted to breach of the Constitutional Court decisions and made direct pressure on the judges of the Court, making them "visits" before important decisions. # The President systematically violated the principle of political non-possession of the person who serves as presidential function and abandoned his constitutional role of mediator in the state and society. # The President seriously violated the Constitution and the fundamental principle of representative democracy, when he said he would not appoint a Prime Minister of the USL, even if this party will get absolute majority in Parliament. * <small>'''Source''': [http://www.gandul.info/politica/cele-sapte-motive-ale-suspendarii-presedintelui-traian-basescu-ce-contine-documentul-usl-9813858 Gândul.info]</small>
== July 29 referendum == {{Main|Romanian presidential impeachment referendum, 2012}} A referendum on impeaching President [[Traian Băsescu]] was held in Romania on July 29, 2012. The referendum was required after Parliament voted in favour of impeaching Băsescu on July 6, and had to take place within a month.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/2012/07/05/uk-romania-politics-idUKBRE86413W20120705 "Romania president accuses government of power grab"], ''Reuters''</ref>
{{multiple image | align = right | direction = vertical | header = Results of the 2012 Romanian presidential impeachment referendum | width = 200
| image1 = Referendum 29 iulie.png | caption1 = Turnout
| image2 = Referendum 29 iulie voturi DA.png | caption2 = Percentage of "yes" votes }} {{Infobox referendum|float=none | yes = 7,403,836 | no = 943,375 | invalid = 111,842 | total = 8,459,053 | electorate = 18,292,464 | notes = Source: [http://www.becreferendum2012.ro/DOCUMENTE%20BEC/Rezultate/Rezultate%20finale.pdf Romanian Electoral Commission] }} Initially, in press was rumored that the referendum wasn't validated due to presence under 50% at vote. Central Electoral Bureau announced on August 1, 2012 the final results of the referendum regarding president Traian Băsescu's dismissal. According to BEC data, 46.24% of citizens entitled to vote attended the referendum. For Băsescu's dismissal voted 87.52%, and against 11.15%. 1.32% was the percentage of invalid votes.<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/news/referendum-2012-rezultate-finale-bec-prezenta-la-vot-46-24-pentru-demiterea-lui-basescu-au-votat-87-52-iar-impotriva-11-15-9913998 "2012 referendum. BEC final results. Presence at vote 46.24%. For Băsescu's dismissal voted 87.52%, and against 11.15%."], ''Gândul.info''</ref> On August 2, the judge Aspazia Cojocaru declared, after the Constitutional Court meeting, that from her point of view referendum ought to be canceled, because it was based on false data.<ref>[http://www.antena3.ro/politica/aspazia-cojocaru-referendumul-trebuia-anulat-pentru-ca-s-a-bazat-pe-date-false-178540.html "Aspazia Cojocaru: The referendum ought to be canceled, because it was based on false data."], ''Antena3.ro''</ref> According to [[Demographic history of Romania|20 October 2011 census]], in Romania there aren't 18 million citizens eligible to vote, how many were registered on electoral lists.
Constitutional Court decided on August 21 that 29 July Romanian presidential impeachment referendum is invalid, and Traian Băsescu will return at the Cotroceni Palace. According to official sources, the decision was taken by 6 votes to 3.<ref>[http://www.mediafax.ro/social/cc-referendumul-pentru-demiterea-presedintelui-e-invalid-basescu-revine-la-cotroceni-9966327 "CCR: Romanian presidential impeachment referendum is invalid. Băsescu will return at the Cotroceni Palace"], ''Mediafax.ro''</ref> Shortly after this decision, Foundation for Defense of Citizens Against State Abuses sued the Romanian state at [[European Court of Human Rights]] for invalidation of the referendum. "Despite all normative acts in effect, recommendations of the Venice Commission, actual updated figures, the nine judges of the Constitutional Court of Romania ignore the political choice of the Romanians. In present-day Romania, the volition of 9 political appointees is above the volition of a nation", was said in a FACIAS communique.<ref>[http://www.ziare.com/politica/referendum/decizia-ccr-de-invalidare-a-referendumului-reclamata-la-cedo-1185578 "CCR decision on the referendum, reported at ECHR"], ''Ziare.com''</ref> Furthermore, Foundation representatives say in CCR decisions material is not respected the principle of the double degree of jurisdiction, in that CCR decisions can not be appealed to any internal tribunal.
=== Communique issued by the Constitutional Court === {{Quote box |quote = On August 21, 2012, Plenum of the Constitutional Court, vested under Article 146 let. (i) of the Constitution and under Article 46-47 of the Law no. 47/1992 regarding the organization and functioning of the Constitutional Court, with the majority provided for in Article 47 para. (1) of Law no. 47/1992, decided: :1. Finds that the procedure for organizing and conducting national referendum on July 29, 2012 to dismiss the President of Romania, Mr. Traian Băsescu, was observed. :2. Confirms the results of the national referendum on July 29, 2012 provided by the Central Electoral Bureau and found that out of 18,292,464 persons listed in the permanent electoral lists participated in the vote 8,459,053 people (46.24%), of which 7,403,836 (87.52%) responded "yes" to the question "Do you agree with the dismissal of the President of Romania Mr. Traian Băsescu?", and 943,375 (11.15%) responded "no". :3. Finds that at the referendum did not attend at least half plus one of the voters included in permanent electoral lists, as the referendum to be valid in accordance with Article 5 para. (2) of Law no. 3/2000 regarding organization and conduct of the referendum. :4. At the date of publication of this Decision in the Official Gazette of Romania, Part I, the interim of Mr. George – Crin Laurenţiu Antonescu to exercise the office of President of Romania ceases. :5. From the date of publication of this Decision in the Official Gazette of Romania, Part I, Mr. Traian Băsescu resumes exercise of constitutional and legal attributions of President of Romania. This Decision will be presented to the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate, met in joint session. The judgment is final and binding and will be published in the Official Gazette of Romania, Part I, and in the press. |source = [http://www.rtv.net/de-ce-a-invalidat-curtea-constitutionala-referendumul-din-29-iulie_41064.html ''Why the Constitutional Court invalidated the referendum of 29 July'', '''România TV'''] |quoted = 1 |width = 100% |align = left }}
=== Controversies === On July 24, the President of PDL decided to urge voters to not vote at July 29's Romanian presidential impeachment referendum. The decision was made by 59 votes in favor and one abstention.<ref>[http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/pdl-boicoteaza-referendumul-alegatorii-sa-nu-participe-la-vot-pe-29-iulie-9899083 "PDL boycotts the referendum: Voters should not vote on July 29"], ''Mediafax.ro''</ref> Prime Minister Victor Ponta said that this action is illegal and the party led by Vasile Blaga should be acted criminally.<ref>[http://www.corectnews.com/politics/intern/ponta-boicotarea-referendumului-e-ilegala-voi-trimite-o-scrisoare-partenerilor-nostr "Ponta: Boycott is illegal. I will send a letter to our European partners"], ''CorectNews.com''</ref>
After casting a ballot in the referendum, Prime Minister Victor Ponta expressed "outrage" over what he called his Hungarian counterpart [[Viktor Orbán]]'s intervention in the country’s internal politics by telling ethnic Hungarians in Romania to stay away from the polls in a recall referendum. A count of voters from around 5pm showed turnout was lowest in the Harghita and Covasna counties, at 6.85% and 12.39%, respectively. Likewise, [[Attila Mesterházy]], [[Hungarian Socialist Party]] leader, warned that Orbán's statements in Romania will affect the minority of ethnic Hungarians, "both short-term and long-term", considering that Hungarian Prime Minister gesture is an interference in the internal affairs of Romania. In both counties, ethnic Hungarians constitute the majority of the population.<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-12921624-declaratiile-lui-orban-romania-vor-afecta-etnicii-maghiari-avertizeaza-socialistii-ungari.htm "Viktor Orbán's statements in Romania will affect the Hungarians, Hungarian socialists warn"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref><ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-12904413-referendum-pentru-demiterea-presedintelui-traian-basescu-sectiile-votare-deschid-ora-07-00.htm "Victor Ponta: I am very shocked that Hungarian Prime Minister, Viktor Orbán, urges Romanian citizens of Hungarian ethnicity to not come to vote"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref><ref>[http://www.politics.hu/20120730/romanian-pm-claims-outrage-over-hungarian-counterparts-comments-on-impeachment-referendum/ "Romanian PM claims «outrage» over Hungarian counterpart's comments on impeachment referendum"], ''Politics.hu''</ref>
The [[European Commissioner for Justice, Fundamental Rights and Citizenship|European Commissioner for Justice]], [[Viviane Reding]], said that after the referendum for President Traian Băsescu's dismissal, there were new pressures and attempts to influence the outcome. Reding said the referendum could not end the political crisis and pressures on judges have continued even after finding out the results, to influence them. She said "the situation in Romania remains fragile", expressing the hope that all political actors in the country are determined to bear "durable and irreversible" the rule of law and judicial independence.<ref>[http://www.ziare.com/politica/referendum/reding-dupa-referendum-au-existat-noi-incercari-de-influentare-a-rezultatului-1189735 "Reding: Situation remains fragile in Romania, to respect the rule of law"], ''Ziare.com''</ref> In response to Reding's statements, the President of the group of the [[Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats]], [[Hannes Swoboda]], said, on September 12, in the European Parliament plenary, that, by reactions to the situation in recent months in Romania, has been impugned the objectivity of EC. "Why not responded with months before to the facts of Mr. Băsescu?", S&D leader in PE asked. Hannes Swoboda also showed that 7.4 million Romanians expressed in the referendum against President Băsescu, much more than elected him. He accused PDL MEPs, including [[Monica Macovei]], of propaganda with falsehoods against USL.<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/swoboda-atac-la-reding-ati-pus-sub-semnul-intrebarii-obiectivitatea-comisiei-europene_44167.html "Swoboda, attack on Reding: You impugned the objectivity of the European Commission"], ''România TV''</ref>
"Where, if not here in PE, you must tell why vote of 8.4 million citizens did not matter at all to you this summer, why a rule that isn't valid anywhere in Europe was imposed to Romania and here I refer to the 50% to vote", said PSD MEP [[Cătălin Ivan]], in his speech in EP plenary, at the debate on the political situation in Romania. Addressing to Reding, Ivan claimed that she has "acted as canvasser" of Traian Băsescu.<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/catalin-ivan-catre-reding-in-pe-v-ati-comportat-ca-un-agent-electoral-al-lui-basescu_44164.html "Cătălin Ivan, to Reding, in EP: You have acted as Băsescu's canvasser"], ''România TV''</ref>
==December 9 legislative election== {{Main|Romanian legislative election, 2012}} {{multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | header = Results of the 2012 Romanian legislative election | width = 200
| image1 = Senatori 2012.png | caption1 = Senate
| image2 = Deputati 2012.png | caption2 = Chamber of Deputies }} Legislative elections were held in [[Romania]] on 9 December 2012. The [[Social Liberal Union]] of Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]] won an absolute majority in both the [[Chamber of Deputies (Romania)|Chamber of Deputies]] and the [[Senate (Romania)|Senate]].<ref>[http://www.antena3.ro/politica/romania-la-vot/alegeri-parlamentare-usl-a-castigat-detasat-alegerile-in-25-de-judete-basescu-va-chema-marti-sau-miercuri-partidele-la-consultari-195224.html "The latest official results of legislative elections. View the document published by BEC"], ''Antena3.ro''</ref>
Cezar Preda resigned as senior vice-president of PDL and as president of PDL Buzău<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-13785944-cezar-preda-demisionat-din-conducerea-pdl.htm "Cezar Preda resigned as senior vice-president of the PDL and as president of the PDL Buzău"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref> shortly after the Central Electoral Bureau published the first results of the elections, according to that he would have lost a new mandate in [[Buzău County]], in favor of Marcel Ciolacu, his rival from the USL.<ref>[http://www.cronicaromana.ro/2012/12/10/cezar-preda-a-pierdut-clar-alegerile-in-buzau/?ref=head "Cezar Preda clearly lost the elections in Buzău"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130416133921/http://www.cronicaromana.ro/2012/12/10/cezar-preda-a-pierdut-clar-alegerile-in-buzau/?ref=head |date=2013-04-16 }}, ''Cronica Română''</ref> Likewise, Cristian Preda resigned as senior vice president of the PDL during the Board of Directors meeting of December 14.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/politica/cristian-preda-am-demisionat-din-conducerea-pdl-pentru-ca-am-asumat-ca-obiectiv-30-la-alegeri-287440.html "Cristian Preda: I resigned from the leadership of PDL because we assumed as objective 30 percent in elections"], ''România Liberă''</ref> A similar decision was taken by Sever Voinescu.<ref>[http://www.realitatea.net/furtuna-in-pdl-cristian-preda-a-demisionat-din-conducerea-pdl_1073874.html "Storm in PDL after the election. Cristian Preda and Sever Voinescu resigned"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121217033525/http://www.realitatea.net/furtuna-in-pdl-cristian-preda-a-demisionat-din-conducerea-pdl_1073874.html |date=2012-12-17 }}, ''Realitatea.net''</ref> [[Dan Diaconescu]] is not covered in the next Parliament. According to [[Gorj County]] Electoral Bureau, Diaconescu was voted by 32.47% of voters. His main opponent was himself [[Prime Minister of Romania]], Victor Ponta, which received 60.98% of votes.<ref>[http://www.realitatea.net/rezultate-alegeri-parlamentare-2012-gorj-senzational-dan-diaconescu-nu-intra-in-parlament_1071032.html "Dan Diaconescu is not covered in the next Parliament"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121211211438/http://www.realitatea.net/rezultate-alegeri-parlamentare-2012-gorj-senzational-dan-diaconescu-nu-intra-in-parlament_1071032.html |date=2012-12-11 }}, ''Realitatea.net''</ref>
Once with the legislative elections, the [[Right Romania Alliance]] was dissolved, under the pretext that the alliance was only an electoral association.<ref>[http://www.antena3.ro/politica/ard-s-a-desfiintat-dupa-alegeri-functionand-doar-ca-alianta-electorala-195495.html "ARD was dissolved after the elections, functioning only as electoral alliance"], ''Antena3.ro''</ref> Amid the failure of elections, more PDL members demanded the resignation of president of the PDL, [[Vasile Blaga]].<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-13795044-jocuri-fac-pdl-care-sunt-problemele-cum-pozitioneaza-taberele-vezi-cine-cere-demisia-lui-blaga-cine-pledeaza-pentru-strangere-randurilor.htm "What games are in PDL, which are the problems and how position the groups. See who requires Blaga's resignation and who advocates for gathering lines"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref>
===Electioneering=== The electioneering, initiated on November 9 and ended on December 8, was not without incidents. [[Dan Diaconescu]], candidate from [[People's Party – Dan Diaconescu|PP-DD]] in the same college of Chamber of Deputies in [[Târgu Jiu]] with Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]], is investigated for electoral bribery.<ref>[http://www.evz.ro/detalii/stiri/alegeri-parlamentare-dan-diaconescu-cercetat-pentru-ca-si-a-mituit-electoratul-cu-mici-s-101047.html "Dan Diaconescu, investigated because he bribed voters with mititei and biscuits. The defendant answers: «Ponta is envious!»"], ''Evz.ro''</ref> Authorities were notified after PSD representatives within Gorj County Council filed a complaint regarding the distribution of food and the organization of an electoral spectacle before the electioneering.<ref>[http://www.libertatea.ro/detalii/articol/dan-diaconescu-cercetat-mici-biscuiti-422176.html "Dan Diaconescu, investigated for mititei and biscuits!], ''Libertatea.ro''</ref> According to the Emergency Ordinance issued on November 6 by [[First Ponta cabinet|Ponta Cabinet]], offering food, drink and money in the campaign is illegal.<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-13560154-guvernul-discuta-oug-privind-oferirea-alimente-bauturi-bani-campania-electorala.htm "Government approved the Emergency Ordinance on offering food, drink and money in the campaign"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref>
The President of PDL Vrancea, Alin Trășculescu, was caught in the act by anticorruption prosecutors while receiving €50,000 from a businessman in the form of bribe.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/deputatul-pdl-alin-trasculescu-acuzat-ca-a-cerut-150-000-de-euro-mita-pentru-a-interveni-la-guvern-283718.html "PDL deputy Alin Trășculescu, accused that demanded 150,000 euros bribe, to intervene in the government"], ''România Liberă''</ref> He was detained for 24 hours for allegations of lobbyism, instigation to false and incitement to the misdemeanor of money laundering.<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/news/deputatul-pdl-alin-trasculescu-retinut-pentru-24-de-ore-dna-il-acuza-de-trafic-de-influenta-si-instigare-la-fals-in-acte-si-spalare-de-bani-update-10292644 "PDL deputy Alin Trășculescu, detained for 24 hours. DNA accused him of lobbyism, instigation to false in documents and money laundering"], ''Gândul.info''</ref> Alin Trășculescu was under the supervision of National Anticorruption Department for two years. He claimed he could get contracts with the State, from the Ministry of Development and Tourism, led then by [[Elena Udrea]]. Eventually, Bucharest Court decided to arrest Alin Trășculescu for 29 days.<ref>[http://jurnalul.ro/stiri/observator/tribunalul-bucuresti-judeca-cererea-dna-privind-arestarea-fostului-deputat-alin-trasculescu-630166.html "Alin Trășculescu, taken into custody. Former deputy will stay behind bars for 29 days"], ''Jurnalul Național''</ref>
In a commune from [[Buzău County]], USL representatives clashed with ARD sympathizers, the conflict being resolved at the arrival of local police.<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/alegeri-2012/buzau-bataie-intre-doua-echipe-de-campanie-ale-usl-si-ard-285150.html "Buzău: Fight between two campaign teams of USL and ARD"], ''România Liberă''</ref> Two people were seriously injured and four others arrested in the altercation.<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/politica/campanie-electorala-cu-pumni-si-picioare-la-buzau-cezar-preda-cere-securizare-10348531 "Campaign with fists and feet in Buzău. Cezar Preda calls for «security»"], ''Gândul.info''</ref> On December 3, several dozens of supporters of USL, sympathizers of Victor Ponta candidate for another term as deputy in [[Gorj County]] had a confrontation which escalated into fray and fight in [[Târgu Jiu]] with the supporters of Dan Diaconescu, the PPDD rival of the Prime Minister.<ref>[http://www.antena3.ro/romania/scandal-electoral-si-bataie-la-targu-jiu-un-sustinator-usl-a-ajuns-la-spital-194446.html "Electoral scandal and fight in Târgu Jiu, an USL supporter came to the hospital"], ''Antena3.ro''</ref> Following clashes, a young man was injured and taken to hospital.<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/incaierare-electorala-la-targu-jiu-sustinatorii-usl-si-ppdd-s-au-luat-la-cearta_56153.html "Electoral fray in Târgu Jiu: USL and PPDD supporters were taken to quarrel"], ''România TV''</ref>
==Protests== [[File:Discurs Băsescu 3, protest Piaţa Revoluţiei 26-7-12.jpg|thumb|left|Traian Băsescu, the impeached Romanian President, speaking at a meeting in his support.]] The political turmoil fractured Romanian society. Currently, the Romanian people are divided into two camps: anti-Băsescu and pro-Băsescu.{{citation needed|date=July 2012}} Despite high temperatures, driven from behind by their parties or on their own, in several areas of the country, people began to leave the streets to defend their favorites or to protest their opponents. Thus, relatively peaceful protests have erupted in major cities of Romania. In [[Arad, Romania|Arad]], protests turned violent when Băsescu's opponents and sympathizers clashed. The groups were quickly dispersed by police.<ref>[http://cronicaromana.ro/2012/07/05/politicienii-au-bagat-vrajba-intre-romani/ "Politicians have put enmity between Romanians"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130416140713/http://cronicaromana.ro/2012/07/05/politicienii-au-bagat-vrajba-intre-romani/ |date=2013-04-16 }}, ''Cronica Română''</ref> None of the groups participating in action on Thursday evening has no authorization, can not specifying how protests will last.<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/news/conflict-intre-participantii-la-mitinguri-contra-si-pro-basescu-la-arad-9820367 "Conflict between participants in rallies against and pro-Basescu, in Arad"], ''Gândul.info''</ref>
Street protests were also organized in [[Bucharest]]. About one hundred people protested on July 4 at University Square against the political class. Those present displayed messages against exploitation in [[Roșia Montană]] and shale gas. At Victory Square, occurred a new demonstration against the current leadership, and came, as one day ago, former Prime Minister [[Mihai Răzvan Ungureanu]]. He argued that it is normal that people to leave in the streets, criticizing USL leader Ponta and Antonescu, which he said that "have succeeded to demonstrate how it can be trampled the Constitution". Ungureanu has transmitted to demonstrators that "he awaits them Thursday", in Revolution Square, where the [[Liberal Democratic Party (Romania)|Liberal Democratic Party]] announced the organization of an anti-USL meeting.
In the following days, protests were amplified, such that more than 2,000 people gathered at the meeting on Thursday evening, in University Square, in a demonstration in support of President Traian Băsescu, attended by prominent members of the PDL. From Thursday's protests were not without any incidents. Attending the pro-Băsescu meeting, Raluca Turcan went faint to the end of the meeting and another five people needed medical care after they felt sick to rally in Revolution Square.<ref>[http://www.rtv.net/proteste-pro-si-contra-basescu-in-bucuresti-lupta-politica-s-a-mutat-in-strada-video_35132.html "Pro- and anti-Băsescu protests in Bucharest: Political struggle moved into the street"], ''România TV''</ref> Some demonstrators in University Square were fought, Thursday evening, and were separated by gendarmes in device on-site, that raised two people from among recalcitrants. Protesters had altercations after two of them were taken by the gendarmes.<ref>[http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/actualitate/proteste-contra-basescu-in-piata-universitatii-cativa-manifestanti-s-au-luat-la-bataie.html "Pro- and anti-Băsescu protests in Bucharest. Some protesters were fought"], ''Știrile PRO TV''</ref>
In [[Timișoara]], the two groups of protesters were nearly to confront. PDL sympathizers and supporters of the President gathered Thursday evening in the center of Timișoara to denounce what they call abusive measures taken by Ponta government in last days. Spirits were heated when in the area has appeared a group of supporters of USL, shouting slogans against the President. The dispute between the two groups, initially only verbal, risked to degenerate, so gendarmes immediately intervened to appease spirits.<ref>[http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/actualitate/proteste-au-avut-loc-si-in-tara-jandarmii-au-intervenit-la-timisoara-pentru-a-linisti-spiritele.html "Protests took place in the country. Gendarmes intervened to calm the spirits in Timișoara"], ''Știrile PRO TV''</ref>
On July 20, USL organized largest demonstration to date in [[Craiova]], "a major political rally with about 20,000 people".<ref>[http://cronicaromana.ro/2012/07/20/uselistii-se-pregatesc-de-mitingul-anti-basescu-de-la-craiova/ USL members prepare for anti-Băsescu meeting in Craiova"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130416103509/http://cronicaromana.ro/2012/07/20/uselistii-se-pregatesc-de-mitingul-anti-basescu-de-la-craiova/ |date=2013-04-16 }}, ''Cronica Română''</ref> At the manifestation attended [[Victor Ponta]], [[Valeriu Zgonea]], [[Olguța Vasilescu]] and several ministers.<ref>[http://a1.ro/news/politic/miting-usl-la-craiova-18-000-de-oameni-cer-demiterea-lui-basescu.html "USL meeting in Craiova: 18,000 people require Băsescu's dismissal"], ''A1.ro''</ref> Olguța Vasilescu addressed to the crowd, saying that the country must get rid of "democracy's cancer, Traian Băsescu". Prime Minister Ponta also held a speech. [[Rovana Plumb]], [[Titus Corlățean]], [[Daniel Constantin (politician)|Daniel Constantin]], [[Mircea Geoană]] and [[Călin Popescu Tăriceanu]] were also present at the meeting. According to spokesman of [[Dolj County]] Inspectorate of Gendarmes Ionuț Savu, the meeting was attended by approximately 18,000 people, from several counties. In [[Marin Sorescu]] Theater area, traffic was blocked for several hours.
Another major political rallies were organized by USL on July 17 in [[Brașov]] (5,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-politic-12819872-miting-usl-brasov-pentru-demiterea-lui-traian-basescu-peste-5-000-persoane-participa-manifestatie.htm "USL meeting in Brașov, for Traian Băsescu's dismissal: more than 5,000 people attended the manifestation"], ''HotNews.ro''</ref> on July 22 in [[Iași]] (15,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.evz.ro/detalii/stiri/crin-antonescu-si-victor-ponta-la-mitingul-usl-de-la-iasi-992966.html "Victor Ponta, at USL meeting in Iași: 'I am proud to be sworn by Traian Băsescu'"], ''Evz.ro''</ref> on July 24 in [[Oradea]] (8,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.antena3.ro/romania/aproximativ-8-000-de-persoane-participa-la-mitingul-usl-de-la-oradea-da-la-referendum-177012.html "Approximately 8,000 people attended the USL meeting in Oradea: «YES in the referendum»"], ''Antena3.ro''</ref> on July 25 in [[Pitești]] (7,000 participants)<ref>[http://www.adevarul.ro/locale/alexandria/Cateva-Arges-Teleorman-Traian-Basescu_0_743925604.html "Thousands of people at meetings in Argeș and Teleorman for Traian Băsescu's dismissal"], ''Adevărul.ro''</ref> and [[Alexandria]] (1,500 participants), on July 26 at [[Romexpo]], [[Bucharest]] (50,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.adevarul.ro/locale/bucuresti/bucuresti-miting_usl-romexpo-referendum_2012-sustinatori_0_743925886.html# "The USL meeting began at Romexpo, with concert. Protesters arrive from the country, in waves"], ''Adevărul.ro''</ref> on July 27 in [[Râmnicu Vâlcea]] (700 participants).
In several cities throughout Romania were organized pro-Băsescu meetings, that few people attended: [[Bucharest]] (15,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/politica/miting-pro-basescu-15-000-de-pedelisti-asteptati-in-piata-revolutiei-9904665 "Pro-Băsescu meeting. 15,000 PDL sympathizers expected in the Revolution Square"], ''Gândul.info''</ref> [[Iași]] (10,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.libertatea.ro/detalii/articol/taie-miting-iasi-pro-basescu-404961.html "Fight at pro-Băsescu meeting, organized in Iași"], ''Libertatea.ro''</ref> [[Cluj-Napoca]] (10,000 participants),<ref>[http://www.zf.ro/politica/circa-10-000-de-participanti-la-mitingul-pro-basescu-de-la-cluj-9861861 "10,000 participants at pro-Băsescu meeting in Cluj-Napoca"], ''Zf.ro''</ref> [[Slatina, Romania|Slatina]] (100 participants).
